name: Scarborough Folk Fest 2025
description:
An annual cultural celebration that brings together people from diverse communities through folk music, art, and shared stories. As an inclusive and vibrant community event, we aim to showcase the multicultural richness of Scarborough through engaging programming that attracts local residents, tourists, and international audiences.

This year's event promises to be our best yet, bringing together musicians from across Canada who represent a rich tapestry of ethnic, cultural, and diverse backgrounds.

name: Community Environment Day at Centrepoint Mall
description:
Join Councillor Cheng (Ward 18) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Dream Wheels on Eglinton

location.name: On Eglinton Ave W between Oriole Parkway and Chaplin Crescent

description:
A vintage car and motorcycle festival celebrating the finest classic cars, hot rods, muscle cars, race cars and motorcycles! Enjoy live music, family-friendly activities, delicious food and unique shopping. Don't miss our Best in Show Awards Ceremony and fabulous Glamour Pin-Up Contest on the main stage - it's a day of fun, nostalgia and excitement for all!

 Event is held in support of Sick Kids Hospital.

name: AlohaFest Toronto 2025
description: Get swept away by the rhythms, flavours, and traditions of Polynesia at the city's original and only festival uniting the vibrant cultures of the Pacific Islands. Presented by Hālau Hula I Ka Lā,  join us for a full day of exhilarating Polynesian dance performances, explore a curated selection of island-inspired vendors, and treat your taste buds to flavours of Pacific cuisine. Whether you're returning or joining us for the first time, you'll experience the true meaning of Aloha - warmth, unity, and joy. E komo mai, "Welcome"!
